about.title: A Little Bit About Me
about.description: My name is João Victor, but you can call me Jão if you want. I'm a developer who loves creating — I don't mind whether it's backend or frontend. I have a degree in Systems Analysis and Development from UNIP and have also completed several programming courses. I'm currently eager to find an opportunity to show my skills, learn new ones, and collaborate with more experienced developers, always striving to improve both my hard and soft skills.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: I like to build personal projects as part of my learning — here are a few of them.
projects.thoth-description: Thoth-Pomodoro is a web app that helps you manage your Pomodoro cycles. It's fully configurable — focus time, short and long breaks, themes — and it also saves your activity history.
projects.recipes-api-description: API built with Django for managing culinary recipes, focused on organization and scalability. The system includes user registration and login, JWT authentication, recipe categorization, and management of ingredients and steps. Users can create, read, update and delete their recipes while they are not public. Once an administrator approves a recipe, the user can no longer edit it — it becomes part of the site and credit is given to the creator.
projects.recipes-frontend-description: Frontend developed in TypeScript with React + Next.js, integrating my <1>recipes API</1> via JWT and Route Handlers. Styled with Tailwind CSS for fast, responsive rendering. Main features: recipe CRUD, user profile updates, personalized dashboards, listings and detail pages, and search by name/tags. Componentization, state management, SSR/CSR as needed, and secure API consumption practices.
